text:
JESUS TEACHING ABOUT HIMSELF

Jesus as the Lamb 

Joh 1:29 The next day he saw Jesus coming toward him, and said, "Behold, the Lamb of God, who takes away the sin of the world!

Joh 1:30 This is he of whom I said, 'After me comes a man who ranks before me, for he was before me.'

Joh 1:31 I myself did not know him; but for this I came baptizing with water, that he might be revealed to Israel."

Joh 1:32 And John bore witness, "I saw the Spirit descend as a dove from heaven, and it remained on him.

Joh 1:33 I myself did not know him; but he who sent me to baptize with water said to me, 'He on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain, this is he who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.'

Joh 1:34 And I have seen and have borne witness that this is the Son of God."

 

Jesus as the Door and the good Shepherd (John 10: 1 – 18).

Jesus again figuratively compared himself to the door and the good shepherd. According to him, anyone who does not enter the sheepfold by the door but climbs in through another means is a thief and a robber; but he who enters by the door is the shepherd of the sheep. To such a person, the gate keeper opens the gate for. 

The sheep hear his voice and he call his sheep by name and leads them out because they know him. On the contrary, the sheep would run away from the hireling because they do not know him and cannot recognize his voice. According to him, the thief would come through the window because he is not the owner and the sheep would not stand his sight. 

Jesus equally presented himself as the door of the sheep, insisting that all who came before him referring to the false prophets were thieves and robbers. He maintained that as the door, anyone who enters through him would be saved, and would go in and out to find pasture. He said that the thief only came to steal, kill and destroy, while he (Jesus) came that his flock may have abundant life. 

As the good shepherd, Jesus maintained that he came to lay down his life for the sake of his sheep, unlike a hireling who is not a good shepherd and therefore does not care for the sheep. 

According to Jesus, a hireling runs away whenever he sees a wolf, leaving the sheep because 

they do not belong to him. He further noted that there are other of his sheep that are not within 

the fold, but as a good shepherd, he would bring them back to the fold, so as to have one flock and one shepherd. The sheep outside the fold refer to the unbelievers, who would eventually be brought into the fold of which Christ is the head. 

 

Jesus as the Light (John 3: 19)

Joh 3:19 And this is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.

 

Jesus as the living Water 

Joh 4:10 Jesus answered her, "If you knew the gift of God, and who it is that is saying to you, 'Give me a drink,' you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water."

 

Jesus as the bread of life 

Joh 6:33 For the bread of God is that which comes down from heaven, and gives life to the world."

Joh 6:34 They said to him, "Lord, give us this bread always."

Joh 6:35 Jesus said to them, "I am the bread of life; he who comes to me shall not hunger, and he who believes in me shall never thirst.

 

Jesus as the True vine

Joh 15:1 "I am the true vine, and my Father is the vinedresser.

Joh 15:2 Every branch of mine that bears no fruit, he takes away, and every branch that does bear fruit he prunes, that it may bear more fruit.

Joh 15:3 You are already made clean by the word which I have spoken to you.

Joh 15:4 Abide in me, and I in you. As the branch cannot bear fruit by itself, unless it abides in the vine, neither can you, unless you abide in me.

Joh 15:8 By this my Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit, and so prove to be my disciples.

Joh 15:6 If a man does not abide in me, he is cast forth as a branch and withers; and the branches are gathered, thrown into the fire and burned.

Joh 15:8 By this my Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit, and so prove to be my disciples.

Joh 15:8 By this my Father is glorified, that you bear much fruit, and so prove to be my disciples.

Example 

According to the Gospel of John, Jesus is the true vine while the vinedresser is

A. the Holy Spirit B. His father

C. the gardener D. His mother.

B

 

Example 

In the teaching on the true vine, Jesus said that any branch that bears fruit will be 

A. harvested. B. pruned

C. pegged. D. grafted.

B

 

 

Jesus as the resurrection and Life 

Joh 11:17 Now when Jesus came, he found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb four days.

Joh 11:21 Martha said to Jesus, "Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.

Joh 11:25 Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life; he who believes in me, though he die, yet shall he live,

As life

1Jo 5:11 And this is the testimony, that God gave us eternal life, and this life is in his Son.

1Jo 5:12 He who has the Son has life; he who has not the Son of God has not life.

 

Example

Jesus did not go immediately to attend to Lazarus who was reported sick because He

A. did not know how serious the sickness was

B. wanted His disciples to believe in Him

C. cared less about Lazarus

D. was too busy attending to other people.

 

Option B

Reference: John 11: 14 - 15

[14] Then Jesus told them plainly, "Lazarus is dead; 

[15] and for your sake I am glad that I was 

not there, so that you may believe. But let 

us go to him."
